meanings.definition: The loose threads or fibers that hang from a woven fabric.
meanings.sent1: I picked off the ravelings from my sweater to make it look neat.
meanings.sent2: The tailor trimmed the ravelings from the hem of the dress.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the ravelings, creating a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like ravelings, tangled and hard to unravel.
meanings.sent5: The colorful ravelings added a unique touch to the tapestry.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is unraveled or disentangled.
meanings.sent1: The detective saw the ravelings of the mystery slowly coming together.
meanings.sent2: The old book was a ravelings of forgotten stories waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved pulling a rabbit out of a hat full of ravelings.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a ball of ravelings, waiting to be sorted out.
meanings.sent5: The ravelings of the old rope were carefully untangled by the sailor.
